text.section:
A receiver shall have the following duties:
To collect, preserve, and liquidate the bank's assets as expeditiously as is compatible with the best interests of the bank and its depositors, creditors and shareholders;
To file with the receivership court:
A detailed statement of the assets and liabilities of the bank within thirty (30) days of confirmation; and
A report of its actions in the administration of the liquidation proceedings, together with such other information as the receivership court may require, every ninety (90) days thereafter;
To examine claims and reject any claim that is improper; and
Unless the receivership court orders otherwise, furnish such information concerning the bank and the administration of the liquidation proceedings as is requested by a depositor, creditor or shareholder.

law.history: Created 1984 Ky. Acts ch. 324, sec. 47, effective July 13, 1984.
